thread.title: How are they doing? Locals roundup for week 3 of the NFL season
thread.title_full: How are they doing? Locals roundup for week 3 of the NFL season | Deseret News

author: Brandon Gurney
title: How are they doing? Locals roundup for week 3 of the NFL season
text:
Once again it was former Ute Steve Smith stealing the show with an enormous outing during his team's loss to the Cincinnati Bengals.
Upcoming Games BYU Football BYU football stats & schedule Connecticut @ BYU Lavell Edwards Stadium, Provo Oct. 2, 8:15 p.m. 2 Days 3 Hrs 32 Mins 32 Secs Utah 17 Mins 56 Secs USU Football USU football stats & schedule Colo. St @ USU Merlin Olsen Field at Maverik Stadium, Logan Oct. 3, 5:00 p.m. 3 Days 0 Hrs 17 Mins 56 Secs • Maurice Alexander, DB, Utah State, St. Louis Rams, did not record a stat in St. Louis' 12-6 loss to the Pittsburgh Steelers.
• Dres Anderson, WR, Utah, San Francisco 49ers, did not record a stat in San Francisco's 47-7 loss to the Arizona Cardinals.
• Ezekiel Ansah, DE, BYU, Detroit Lions, had three tackles, two of them solo, and two quarterback hits in Detroit's 24-12 loss to the Denver Broncos.
• Matt Asiata, RB, Hunter HS, Utah, Minnesota Vikings, had two rushes for 10 yards and two receptions for five yards during Minnesota's 31-14 win over the San Diego Chargers.
• Zane Beadles, OL, Hillcrest HS, Utah, Jacksonville Jaguars, started at left guard during Jacksonville's 51-17 loss to the New England Patriots.
• Tony Bergstrom, OL, Skyline HS, Utah, Oakland Raiders, was listed as his team's backup center during Oakland's 27-20 win over the Cleveland Browns.
• Sam Brenner, OL, Utah, Miami Dolphins, was listed as his team's backup center in Miami's 41-14 loss to the Buffalo Bills.
• Will Davis, DB, Utah State, Baltimore Ravens, was traded to the Ravens from the Miami Dolphins shortly following Miami's 23-20 loss to the Jacksonville Jaguars.
• John Denney, DS, BYU, Miami Dolphins, handled the long-snapping for the Dolphins in their 41-14 loss to the Buffalo Bills.
• Jordan Devey, OL, Memphis, American Fork HS, 49ers, started at right guard during his team's 47-7 loss to the Arizona Cardinals.
• Alani Fua, LB, BYU, Arizona Cardinals, had a solo tackle in Arizona's 47-7 win over the San Francisco 49ers.
• Paul Kruger, OLB, Timpanogos HS, Utah, Cleveland Browns, had two tackles in Cleveland's 27-20 loss to the Oakland Raiders.
• Nevin Lawson, DB, Utah State, Detroit Lions, did not record a stat in his team's 24-12 loss to the Denver Broncos.
• Star Lotulelei, DL, Bingham HS, Utah, Carolina Panthers, had two tackles, one of them solo, and defended a pass in Carolina's 27-22 win over the New Orleans Saints.
• Curtis Marsh, WR, Utah State, Denver Broncos, did not record a stat in Denver's 24-12 win over the Detroit Lions.
• Keith McGill, S, Utah, Oakland Raiders, did not record a stat in Oakland's 27-20 win over the Cleveland Browns.
• Koa Misi, OLB, Utah, Miami Dolphins, had six solo tackles, one of them for a loss in Miami's 41-14 loss to the Buffalo Bills.
• Haloti Ngata, DT, Highland HS and Oregon, Detroit Lions, defended a pass and had two quarterback hits in Detroit's 24-12 loss to the Denver Broncos.
• Nate Orchard, OLB, Highland HS and Utah, Cleveland Browns, had a solo tackle in Cleveland's 27-20 loss to the Oakland Raiders.
• Stephen Paea, DT, Timpview HS and Oregon State, Washington Redskins, had a solo tackle and two quarterback hits in Washington's 32-21 loss to the New York Giants.
• Tenny Palepoi, DL, Skyline HS and Utah, San Diego Chargers, did not record a stat in San Diego's 31-14 loss to the Minnesota Vikings.
• Donald Penn, OL, Utah State, Oakland Raiders, started at left tackle during Oakland's 27-20 win over the Cleveland Browns.
• Jeremiah Poutasi, OL, Utah, Tennessee Titans, started at right tackle during Tennessee's 35-33 loss to the Indianapolis Colts.
